title: Authors and Citation
text: Sophia Skorik. Author, maintainer. James Benjamin Tidwell. Author. Kwabena Biritwum Nyarko. Author. Ian Ross. Author. Bismark Dwumfour-Asare. Author. Scott Pippa. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Skorik S, Tidwell J, Nyarko K, Ross , Dwumfour-Asare B, Pippa S (2023). “cleanteamghana: Clean Team Ghana.”
code: @Misc{skoriktidwell,   title = {cleanteamghana: Clean Team Ghana},   author = {Sophia Skorik and James Benjamin Tidwell and Kwabena Biritwum Nyarko and Ian Ross and Bismark Dwumfour-Asare and Scott Pippa},   year = {2023},   abstract = {This package compiles user experience data for the Clean Team Ghana container-based sanitation service in Kumasi, Ghana.},   version = {0.0.0.9000}, }

title: Clean Team Ghana
text: package contains compiled data utilized research paper examining user experience Clean Team Ghana’s container-based sanitation service Kumasi, Ghana.

title: Clean Team Ghana
text: can install development version cleanteamghana GitHub : Alternatively, can download individual dataset CSV XLSX file table .

title: Clean Team Ghana
text: research paper associated data package named “Evaluation user experiences Clean Team Ghana container-based sanitation service Kumasi, Ghana” published Journal Water, Sanitations & Hygiene (WASH) Development March 1st, 2022.

title: Clean Team Ghana
text: affordable acceptable sanitation solutions exist densely populated, low-income urban areas. Container-based toilets, considered safely managed sanitation solution, lack substantial insights user experiences, essential governmental considerations. study conducted sanitation quality changes pre- post-enrollment due Clean Team Ghana (CTG) container-based toilet service Kumasi, Ghana, spanning June December 2019. Data gathered installation ten weeks 292 customers. Initially, customers utilized structurally sound public toilets, yet often faced issues like poor hygiene, inadequate handwashing facilities, average 14.3-minute usage time. study revealed CTG offered high-quality service, significantly enhancing customers’ quality life, saving costs, narrowing gender disparities, catering individuals physical disabilities. Fewer 10% customers reported issues CTG, leakage, filling, odor, irregular replacements. evaluation adds weight emerging evidence supporting value users place container-based sanitation densely populated urban settings.

title: Clean Team Ghana
text: data set includes household survey responses sanitation service levels, quality, practices, observed behaviors. Sanitation Quality Life (SanQoL) scores measured 0 (never able) 3 (always able) scale. Sanitation satisfaction scored scale 0 4, 0 representing unsatisfied, 4 representing satisfied, 2 neither satisfied unsatisfied. package provides access single data set. cleanteamghana data set 128 variables 583 observations. overview variable names, see following table.

what: 1) Visualizing Toilet Access Time (Pre-CTG Containers Installation)
title: Clean Team Ghana
text: code snippet utilizes ggplot2 create histogram illustrating time taken access toilets implementation CTG (Clean Team Ghana) containers. histogram showcases distribution time--access values, mean median annotations indicating central tendency.
code: library(ggplot2)  annotations <- data.frame(   x = c(round(mean(cleanteamghana$time_to_access_toilet, na.rm = TRUE), 2),          round(median(cleanteamghana$time_to_access_toilet, na.rm = TRUE), 2)),   y = c(165, 175),   label = c("Mean:", "Median:") )   ggplot(cleanteamghana, aes(time_to_access_toilet)) +   geom_histogram(binwidth = 3, color = "#000000", fill = "#59CF94", boundary = 0, na.rm = TRUE) +   labs(     title = "Time to access toilets before installation of CTG containers",     x = "Time (minutes)",     y = "Count"   ) +   theme_classic() +   theme(     plot.title = element_text(color = "#59CF94", size = 16, face = "bold")   ) +   scale_x_continuous(breaks = seq(0, 60, by = 10)) +   geom_text(data = annotations, aes(x = x, y = y, label = paste(label, x)), size = 3, fontface = "bold")

what: 2) Customer Sanitation Satisfaction Categories: Mean Scores Comparison
title: Clean Team Ghana
text: following code computes mean satisfaction scores across various sanitation categories, presenting comparative analysis bar plot.
code: library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  # Calculating mean scores for each satisfaction category satisfaction_means <- cleanteamghana |>    mutate(across(starts_with("satisfaction"), as.integer)) |>    summarise(across(starts_with("satisfaction"), ~mean(., na.rm = TRUE))) |>    rename_with(~gsub("satisfaction_", "", .), starts_with("satisfaction")) |>    rename_with(~gsub("towards_", "", .), starts_with("towards")) |>    rename_with(~gsub("avoiding_", "", .), starts_with("avoiding"))  # Converting the data to a format suitable for plotting satisfaction_means <- satisfaction_means |>    tidyr::pivot_longer(cols = everything(), names_to = "Satisfaction_Category", values_to = "Mean_Score")  # Creating the bar plot ggplot(satisfaction_means, aes(x = Satisfaction_Category, y = Mean_Score)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "#59CF94", color = "#000000") +   geom_text(aes(label = round(Mean_Score, 2)), vjust = -0.5, color = "black", size = 3.5) +  # Add mean labels on top of bars   labs(     title = "Mean Sanitation Satisfaction Scores",     x = "Satisfaction Category",     y = "Mean Score"   ) +   theme_minimal() +   theme(     axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 60, hjust = 1, size = 8)   )+   ylim(0, 4)

title: Ghana Clean Team Survey — cleanteamghana
text: Clean Team Ghana dataset captures extensive information various aspects container-based sanitation Ghana. includes data household demographics, sanitation facilities, cleanliness perceptions, usage patterns, satisfaction levels, concerns, factors influencing adoption Clean Team Ghana's container-based sanitation services. dataset aims evaluate effectiveness, acceptance, challenges associated container-based sanitation practices Ghanaian communities.
